introduction: I'm a French sustainability changemaker based in Tokyo. After 15 years in public policy for the French government, I moved to Japan in 2016. Initially at the French Embassy, I then joined the private sector to accelerate corporate sustainability mindsets. In 2024, I launched Ichigo Bloom, a collective of freelance facilitators offering sustainability education in Japan.

background.career_evolution: Joined private sector to accelerate corporate sustainability mindsets

how_help_users: I'd love to share with community members my experience in public organizations in Europe, and what I learnt in Japan since 2016.
sustainability_journey: My career started in public policy for urban development, where environmental considerations were present but not central. In the early 2010s, France merged its environmental, land-use, and energy ministries, opening doors to sustainability roles. My first true sustainability position focused on urban renewable energy, leveraging my experience in urban planning while venturing into a new domain. After this, I landed a role as sustainable development councilor at the French Embassy in Tokyo.

career_progression.france_ministry_merger: Early 2010s - environmental, land-use, and energy ministries merged
career_progression.embassy_role: Sustainable development councilor at French Embassy in Tokyo

japan_realization: Living in Japan, I realized the country wasn't as 'green' as I initially thought. This, combined with the rising global focus on climate change following the adoption in 2025 of the Paris Agreement, awakened me to the urgency of sustainability. Things that I didn't use to think a lot about before 2015, like the CO2 impact of my flight from Paris to Tokyo, became a constant consideration. Over the past decade, sustainability has become the core focus of my work.

current_roles.asuene: Lead global intelligence for Japanese climate tech startup offering GHG management solutions - tracking international regulations impacting Japanese and Asia-Pacific companies like EU's CSRD and CBAM
current_roles.ichigo_bloom: Launched 2024 - bridge gap between Japanese organisations and sustainability education resources from other regions, especially Europe

ichigo_bloom_mission: Bridge the gap between Japanese organisations and the wealth of sustainability education resources available in other regions, especially Europe. I work with a collective of passionate freelance facilitators to deliver workshops like the Climate Fresk and Biodiversity Collage in Japanese.
challenges_overcome: The language barrier can hinder Japanese organizations from connecting with global sustainability trends. Without translation into Japanese, many companies are unlikely to engage with these trends. When the TNFD released its framework to help businesses understand biodiversity risks in October last year, only two languages were available: English, for the whole world, and Japanese, for Japan. CDP also does extra efforts to translate all its documents and questionnaires to Japanese.
language_barrier_solution: While my Japanese language skills are still developing, I've learned to work effectively with others who have the expertise I lack. By combining my understanding of global sustainability trends and experience in Europe with the communication expertise of Japanese talent, we create a powerful team. This approach is at the heart of Ichigo Bloom.

collaboration_approach.personal_strength: Understanding of global sustainability trends and experience in Europe
collaboration_approach.outcome: Powerful team breaking down language and cultural barriers

proudest_achievements.ichigo_bloom: Launching Ichigo Bloom fills me with pride. Despite my limited entrepreneurial and private sector experience, this initiative allows me to create positive impact while offering a platform for freelance sustainability professionals to monetize their expertise.
proudest_achievements.too_hot_to_be_cool: Tokyo event series featuring local rock bands raising awareness and funds for climate action. The sold-out first edition in April 2024 raised money for WWF Japan's forest protection projects in Southeast Asia. My hope is to grow this volunteer-driven event.

event_innovation: Connecting climate action with art and entertainment is rare in Japan. I would love to see a famous manga author creating a story about climate change: this could spark change!
creative_vision: Hope to see manga author create climate change story to spark change
